com.intuit.wasabi.analyticsobjects.metrics

Class NormalApproxMetric

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intuit.wasabi.analyticsobjects.metrics.BinomialMetrics.BinomialMetric
      • com.intuit.wasabi.analyticsobjects.metrics.NormalApproxMetric
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    NormalApproxSymMetric

    public class NormalApproxMetric
extends BinomialMetrics.BinomialMetric
    Statistical functions for binomial distributions. Uses a normal approximation to the binomial distribution.

    • Method Detail

      • estimateRate

        public Estimate estimateRate(long number_impressions,
                             long number_actions)
        Calculates the estimate and confidence interval for the rate of a binomial distribution. Uses the Agresti-Coull confidence interval.
        Specified by:
        estimateRate in class BinomialMetrics.BinomialMetric
        Parameters:
        number_impressions - number of unique impressions
        number_actions - number of unique actions
        Returns:
        Estimate with [estimated rate, lower bound of confidence interval, upper bound of confidence interval]
        See Also:
        Interval Estimation for a Binomial Proportion

      • estimateRateDifference

        public Estimate estimateRateDifference(long number_impressions_1,
                                       long number_actions_1,
                                       long number_impressions_2,
                                       long number_actions_2)
        Calculates the estimate and confidence interval for the difference in rates of two binomial distributions. Uses a two-proportion hypothesis test (unpooled).
        Specified by:
        estimateRateDifference in class BinomialMetrics.BinomialMetric
        Parameters:
        number_impressions_1 - number of unique impressions in bucket 1
        number_actions_1 - number of unique actions (of chosen type) in bucket 1
        number_impressions_2 - number of unique impressions in bucket 2
        number_actions_2 - number of unique actions (of chosen type) in bucket 2
        Returns:
        Estimate with [estimated difference in rates, lower bound of confidence interval, upper bound of confidence interval]

      • distinguishableEffectSizes

        public DistinguishableEffectSize distinguishableEffectSizes(long number_impressions_1,
                                                            long number_actions_1,
                                                            long number_impressions_2,
                                                            long number_actions_2)
        Calculates, for the current amount of data, the smallest (closest to 0) effect size that, if measured, could be confidently said to be nonzero. This is NOT a symmetric function; it takes rate_1 as a constant and considers effect size as a function of rate_2.
        Specified by:
        distinguishableEffectSizes in class BinomialMetrics.BinomialMetric
        Parameters:
        number_impressions_1 - number of unique impressions in bucket 1
        number_actions_1 - number of unique actions (of chosen type) in bucket 1
        number_impressions_2 - number of unique impressions in bucket 2
        number_actions_2 - number of unique actions (of chosen type) in bucket 2
        Returns:
        DistinguishableEffectSize with [lower boundary (negative), upper boundary (positive)]; Effect size is the difference in rates between the two buckets.

      • fractionOfData

        public Double fractionOfData(long number_impressions_1,
                             long number_actions_1,
                             long number_impressions_2,
                             long number_actions_2,
                             double effect_size)
        For a given effect size, calculates the amount of data needed to confidently say that effect size, if measured, is nonzero. This is NOT a symmetric function; it takes rate_1 as a constant and considers rate_2 as a function of effect_size.
        Specified by:
        fractionOfData in class BinomialMetrics.BinomialMetric
        Parameters:
        number_impressions_1 - number of unique impressions in bucket 1
        number_actions_1 - number of unique actions (of chosen type) in bucket 1
        number_impressions_2 - number of unique impressions in bucket 2
        number_actions_2 - number of unique actions (of chosen type) in bucket 2
        effect_size - difference in rates between the two buckets, range: [-1, 1]
        Returns:
        current amount of data/amount of data needed

      • predictedDataNeeded

        public Long predictedDataNeeded(double rate,
                                double allocation_percent_1,
                                double allocation_percent_2,
                                double effect_size)
        For a predicted action rate and effect size, calculates the estimated amount of data needed. Uses the pooled action rate for two buckets, which is calculated as: pooled_rate = (number_actions_1 + number_actions_2) / (number_impressions_1 + number_impressions_2). For small effect sizes the pooled action rate is approximately equal to the action rate for either bucket. For similar allocation percentages, the pooled action rate is approximately equal to the average of the action rates.
        Specified by:
        predictedDataNeeded in class BinomialMetrics.BinomialMetric
        Parameters:
        rate - predicted action rate, range [0, 1]
        allocation_percent_1 - allocation percentage for one bucket, range (0, 1)
        allocation_percent_2 - allocation percentage for the other bucket, range (0, 1)
        effect_size - predicted difference in rates between the two buckets, range: [-1, 1]
        Returns:
        total number of unique impressions needed in experiment (sum of unique impressions in *all* buckets)
